main event: A resident of Westwood observed a bright light in the sky that appeared to pulsate and moved slowly behind trees.
interesting points: The light was initially thought to be a star but was larger and seemed closer than others., The object moved horizontally between the branches of two tall trees., The light had the color reminiscent of an old-fashioned coal-oil lamp., The sighting occurred just prior to a storm, leading to visibility issues., The object was observed for an extended period, but its exact duration was not reported.
witness description: a resident of Westwood who observed the light from their window
